content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 8 to node 1 is:

8 -> 6 -> 11 -> 1

Note that the path is shortest by following the edges in the order they appear in the 'edges' array. Therefore, the path is 8, then go to 6, then go to 11, then go to 1. This sequence of edges provides the shortest possible path between node 8 and node 1.

Please note that the reverse of this path (starting from node 1 and ending at node 8) would be:

1 -> 3 -> 7 -> 10 -> 8

This is because the 'edges' array is sorted in ascending order of the target node, so following the edges in reverse order provides the shortest possible path from node 1 to node 8.

The shortest path from node 1 to node 8 is:

1 -> 3 -> 7 -> 8

Note that the path is shortest by following the edges in the order they appear in the 'edges' array. Therefore, the path is 1, then go to 3, then go to 7, then go to 8. This sequence of edges provides the shortest possible path between node 1 and node 8.
